channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dislodged pavement stone blocking driveway/Highway, 2nd January
item.description:
A large pavement stone from the corner of the driveway (or end-of-pavement where dropped curb begins) somehow has dislodged itself and it was in the middle of the road causing a hazard to coming traffic. A motorist stopped and manually move the stone from the highway which is now blocking my driveway and needs to be fixed as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Murray Avenue, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Iced pathway Lairdale and Peabody Hill Wood Pathways, 2nd January
item.description:
No grit anywhere on rosendale road, lairdale estate or peabody Hill wood pathways, grit bin on peabody estate by community centre is empty/has rubbish in it but no grit, pathways are frozen to the point it’s a severe slip hazard - some people on lairdale have mobility issues, worried about health and safety - happy to put grit down myself but no clue where any bins with actual grit in are
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Burrow Walk, Tulse Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Icy road conditions, needs gritting, 2nd January
item.description:
Cars sliding on Lockesley drive due to road conditions, snow turning into ice. Needs gritting, pavement in the same condition.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lockesley Drive, Poverest, Greater London

item.title: Horrible smell for around 3 weeks, 2nd January
item.description:
There has been a horrible smell in the flat for around 3 weeks now which is getting stronger. The smell has become unbearable and has now travelled up to the 7th floor. The strongest point of the smell is as you enter the block and as you travel in the lif
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bradstock Road, Hackney, London

item.description:

item.title: Water pouring from pavement, 2nd January
item.description:
Lots of water is coming from cracked paving. It has been flowing for at least 4 days and no sign of repair. With the cold weather it is making the pavement and road icy.

item.title: Dangerous broken paving, 2nd January
item.description:
